TopicTitle: BSC: Aeris 4a - AND THE WINNER IS:

Articles.Content: yay congrats to all the submitters. Also when's the next one and what is it on?

yay congrats to all the submitters. Also when's the next one and what is it on?

a) Soon

You should know by now that I won't tell you in advance.
So SoonÃ¢â€žÂ¢ ?

@Giggleplex777: congratulations, your R-2 is very nice and I'm glad to get a SSTO with RAPIER engine which is so good to fly with.

One only lack: no action group to close air intakes (it may create unwanted drag in upper atmosphere).

Thanks also to Xeldrak and all contributors for this challenge, I can only imagine how time and energy are needed to keep track of everything and organize it.

Congratulations!

Well done, all builders, judges, voters

Thanks a lot Xeldrak for setting this up, it was a lot of fun.
Well done Giggleplex, good stuff! Hat tip to all the judges and Xeldrak. There was a massive amount of work put it by everyone involved and classy metal to boot!

Yeah, that was a lot of fun. Congrats, Giggle!

Hopefully my schedule will permit me to participate in judging the next one.
Great job Giggle! I should get back into these.
That's four firsts and one second place!
Well done, Giggleplex! You win these a lot...
Good job giggle. Now you got me into the ssto mood again

Good work everyone! This was a lot of fun

Grats to Giggleplex for a truly awesome SSTO! Maybe we'll get you next time

That's four firsts and one second place!

You've got these things nicked. Congrats on a very deserved first place!

A shame I got into the wagon so late... How many stock crafts are left?

Rune. If the one you picked as best end ups winning, you couldn't have done it so bad as a judge, right?
Woo-hoo, it's finally done! Congratulations, Giggleplex!

Sorry about late reply, AFK for the weekend. Congrats Giggleplex a great craft! Thanks to everyone who voted for the Wholphin Hybrid and thanks to Xeldrak for a great Challenge! Look forward to more in the future!
Congratulations, Giggleplex, very, very good and stylish craft

A little late on the video, but here's a quick summary of the finalists. A little redundant at this point I guess

Thanks again Xeldrak! See you guys at the next challenge

Side note: If either Giggleplex or Filthy would prefer not to have their design in this video just let me know and I'll take it down. I forgot to ask, sorry!
No problems from me, your reviews are always fun to watch.

No problems from me, your reviews are always fun to watch.

Cool! And congratulations on taking 2nd btw
Holy cow -- I tried flying these with the latest FAR and am having a devil of a time. The R-2 flips over immediately after take-off -- COG is way behind the lift.

Holy cow -- I tried flying these with the latest FAR and am having a devil of a time. The R-2 flips over immediately after take-off -- COG is way behind the lift.

FAR

there's your probelm

FAR

there's your probelm

Well maybe to some extent, but the mass is well behind the lift--opposite what they should be for any amount of proper control. Plenty of stock craft work fine in FAR. In fact, the other winning craft have COLs where I'd expect to see them.

The front-most tanks in the R-2 were also empty (or nearly so), and by filling them I was able to bring the mass a little forward, but it's still squirrely.

I wonder If I somehow have a bad .craft file? Or did .23.5 mess something up?
